subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: File from tonight
author: Robin Searcy Henson
full_text:
------=_NextPart_000_00F0_01C865EB.33CF9060
Content-Type: text/plain;
	charset="iso-8859-1"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

Yeah, what IS that about anyway?  You create the boxes but get no help usin=
g them.   I wonder about the usefulness of the information as well, and the=
 fact that something talks that shouldn't be there is what intrigues me too=
.  The multiple-level theory makes absolute sense.  I would like to believe=
 we're communicating with angels rather than devils, but that's obviously n=
ot the case, at least not always.  Personally, I want this to be proof of l=
ife after death rather than proof of extraterrestrials or nature spirits or=
 demons, and the fact that I may never know might drive me crazy eventually=
.   

Robin


----- Original Message ----- 
  From: purplespacefriend<mailt=
o:purplealiengirl@...> 
  To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com<mailto:EVP-ITC@y=
ahoogroups.com> 
  Sent: Saturday, February 02, 2008 9:17 PM
  Subject: [EV=
P-ITC] Re: File from tonight


  I have noticed a disturbing trend of box u=
sers to develop what 
  appears to be an ego based "mission" that seems to =
coincide with 
  these supposed technicains. You would think, since I make =
the boxes I 
  would get some assistence from the supopsoed technicains, bu=
t there 
  is none! 

  I do not know who or what communicates. I am unwill=
ing to jump on 
  the higher spirit band wagon, as they seemly produce noth=
ing useful, 
  very little verifiable information, nothing that makes life =
better, 
  nothing that helps me make better boxes. I know only that someth=
ing 
  talks that shouldn't be there, and that keeps me intrigued. As Sun 
=
  Bear used to say, "They don't grow any corn".

  I have a "group" that in=
sists I am their Space Princess, now how 
  wise is it to just accept what =
they say, without question, being that 
  I am niether female, nor Royalty!=


  Curious that I make the boxes, but my input about it's use is so 
  eas=
ily dismissed.

  There is at the very least, multiple levels that can be c=
ontacted, 
  some very manipulative, perhaps demonic if you want to go down=
 that 
  road. If you want them to tell you how great you are, they will 
 =
 certainly do so, that is why the caution. 

  Frank-S

  --- In EVP-ITC@ya=
hoogroups.com<mailto:EVP-ITC%40yahoogroups.com>, "Robin Searcy Henson" 
  <=
MudPuddleFarm@...> wrote:
  >
  > Hi Frank, 
  > 
  > When you mention bein=
g distrustful of what comes through the boxes, 
  are you saying you're ske=
ptical of the "technicians" being who they 
  say they are? Not trying to o=
pen another can of worms here, just 
  wanting to continue learning from yo=
ur experience and research. I 
  get what you're saying about becoming obse=
ssive with the sessions. 
  I've probably asked you this a half dozen times=
 over the last couple 
  of years, but who or what do YOU think you're/we'r=
e communicating 
  with?
  > 
  > Robin
  > 
  > 
  > ----- Original Messag=
e ----- 
  > From: purplespacefriend<mailto:purplealiengirl@...> 
  > To: E=
VP-ITC@yahoogroups.com<mailto:EVP-ITC%40yahoogroups.com><mailto:EVP-ITC@yah=
oogroups.com<mailto:EVP-ITC%40yahoogroups.com>> 
  > Sent: Saturday, Februa=
ry 02, 2008 7:46 PM
  > Subject: [EVP-ITC] Re: File from tonight
  > 
  > 
=
  > Have ya tried EVPmaker? It is based on that random principle, and 
  > =
predates the boxes.
  > 
  > I've heard this stuff before, about random bei=
ng the best, and I 
  > have to disaggree. I also think it unwise to spend =
every waking 
  > moment doing sessions. I think it creates that expectatio=
n, and 
  > perhaps desperation to make contact, and I would tend not to 
 =
 trust 
  > what comes through. 
  > 
  > I don't trust some of this stuff =
because I have yet get any 
  > meaningful assistence with the boxes from t=
he so called 
  technicians. 
  > All I ever got was a telepathic "suggesti=
on" to use the echo 
  boxes. 
  > Everything else was a assemblage of stuf=
f I had worked on in hte 
  past 
  > to solve the problem of "what else co=
uld I use". 
  > 
  > I hate to see yet another go down the road of "this i=
s the 
  onlyest 
  > way". 
  > 
  > Frank-S
  >
